description: [Status: preview] [Name: legacy-form-pytest-raises] [Message: Use context-manager form of pytest.{}()] What it does Checks for non-contextmanager use of pytest.raises, pytest.warns, and pytest.deprecated_call. Why is this bad? The context-manager form is more readable, easier to extend, and supports additional kwargs. Example import pytest excinfo = pytest.raises(ValueError, int, "hello") pytest.warns(UserWarning, my_function, arg) pytest.deprecated_call(my_deprecated_function, arg1, arg2) Use instead: import pytest with pytest.raises(ValueError) as excinfo: int("hello") with pytest.warns(UserWarning): my_function(arg) with pytest.deprecated_call(): my_deprecated_function(arg1, arg2)
